Welcome to dactl!

22/03/2017 #dactl #jekyll

You’ll find this post in your _posts directory. Go ahead and edit it and re-build the site to see your changes. You can rebuild the site in many different ways, but the most common way is to run jekyll serve.

Notice blocks

20/03/2017 #dactl #howto

By default dactl has a couple of special classes which will turn a paragraph into a notice block when added to it. Read on for information on how to use it.

How to create a notice block

Creating notices from your paragraphs works the same way as creating leading post paragraphs.
You need to add a correct class after the paragraph:

Layout settings and more in _config.yml

20/03/2017 #jekyll #dactl #howto

All of the dactl’s configurations has to be set in _config.yml file. Read on for explanation of all of the features that you can toggle, including configuring the layout.

I’ve split dactl’s _config.yml into two parts. First part should be configured by you, second contains important Jekyll & build settings and you should leave it alone, unless you know what you are doing.

Read more

YAML front matter in posts

19/03/2017 #jekyll #dactl #howto

In order to use dactl’s post images with overlays you’ll need to learn how to set them. You do that in post’s YAML frontmatter and I’ll show you how.

YAML Front matter

Each Jekyll post starts with YAML Front 1. For example, this is how this post would look like if I wanted to use all of the options:

  1. Everything in between those two --- ↩

Tags in dactl

18/03/2017 #dactl #howto

Tags are built using Jekyll’s native categories functionality and you need to add them manually as files before using them in posts. Read on to learn how.
